column2: ashbabe, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just switched back to a triphasil birth control. I have been on just about every birth control there is. I remembered taking tri-levlen, I think it was, years ago and having no side effects also, weight loss, but they stopped making it, so after numerous types of birth control and horrible side effects, I searched for it again. I found that Tri-levlen was no longer in production but had several generic brands. I read about the different generics and stumbled upon lutera. Rite-Aid tried to give me enpresse, which is a generic, but I stressed that I wanted this drug and would not budge. They order it for me every month now. It is awesome! I feel like me for the first time in years. I have my sex drive back and my appetite is back to normal. Do not let pharmecies try to sell you what you don't want. They still make trivora and not all generics are the same, believe me I have tried them all. This is the only one for me that works.

column2: arw316, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started Trivora 5 months ago. I have gained 13 lbs, I have mood swings, and severe headaches at least 4 days out of the week. I'm bloated for 2 wks out of the month and start having cramps 2 wks before my period. It did clear up my acne though and I have not gotten pregnant while on it.

column2: jennib, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Long story short - I've been having a period every single day since I started this pill (over a month ago). Not happy at all. Calling the doctor tomorrow to switch to something else.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: LOVE TRIVORA! UNFORTUNTELY THEY ARE NO LONGER MAKING TRIVORA, AND CHANGING EVERYTHING OVER TO ENPRESSE, I TOOK ENPRESSE FOR 2 MONTHS AND HAD THE WORST MOOD SWINGS EVER, BUT WHEN I TOOK THE TRIVORA I WAS FINE, MY MD NOW CHANGED ME TO TRI SPRINTEC, IDK HOW IT WILL BE BUT WE WILL SEE.

column2: KarenO, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I used Trivora for most of (perhaps) the last five years. I didn't really think about it. It did the trick, preventing pregnancy, moderating periods, and preventing cramps without side effects. Then, I moved and my pharmacist switched me to the generic Enpresse without asking or telling me -- claiming it's no longer manufactured -- and I realized how good I had it. Enpresse resulted in either longer periods or spotting for me, irritability/ increased sensitivity to sounds and otherwise, and generally seems to result in me feeling worse during my period. I've also gained a few additional pounds after having had my weight in the same two-pound range for more than 5 years. Anyway, Trivora was good and I want it back.

column2: Necole , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have used Trivora for 8 months now. During the first two weeks I experienced some nausea, after that no negative side effects whatsoever. I gained a little weight during the first 2 months, less than 10 lbs. My weight has remained steady since then. My breasts have enlarged from barely a B cup to a full B or even a C. This is a very welcome side effect! Most importantly, I have not become pregnant, and I do have a very active sex life. I have not experienced reduced libido, if anything an increase. My periods come at the same time each month and with much less discomfort. Overall I am extremely pleased with my experience thus far and plan to continue using Trivora.

column2: P.E. 2012, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking trivora for sometime.  I loved it, never got pregnant, always knew when my period was coming, and never got cramps, or acne.  The downfall, I am 27 years old and developed blood clots in my lungs from using this birth control.  I spent 8 days in the hospital and was on the worst pain of my life.  I want to say that I loved this perscription, until that.  I was also told that I would have died if I didn't go in.  I would advise not taking this birth control.

column2: monegirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Other than having to remember to take this every day it has been great! I haven't had any issues ont even side effects listed! Love it!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began taking trivora four months ago, my health insurance changed and I had to switch from ortho-lo (which I loved.) I am very unhappy with this drug. I have gained a bit of weight, my periods are significantly heavier, my breasts are swollen and sore all the time, and I have had heavy vaginal discharge since I've been taking trivora.

column2: texasheatwave, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take bc pills for high testosterone from PCOS. I just had to post my review of this drug.  My GYNO has tried 3 other pills and this one is by far the best!!  She had me on Loestrin Fe 1/20 which caused awful mood swings, breakthrough bleeding and messed with my mental well-being. She then switched me to Loestrin Fe 1.5/30 which again caused the same issues as stated previously. After being on that crap for too long she put me on Low Ovral, but the pharmacy filled it with Low Ogestrel (generic).  I felt okay on this pill, not great, just okay. I would get very moody the week before my period, I always had cramps during week two of the pack.  I never felt great on this pill.  My doctor finally switched me to Trivora and oh my lord I feel fabulous!!  I was hesitant to take it because the reviews have been awful, but I went ahead and started taking it.  I have more energy and I don't feel grumpy all the time.  I tracked any changes according to the phase of the pack and I noticed during phase 2 (the white pills) I got 3 pimples on my face and I was little more sensitive to stupid stuff, but it wasn't anything crazy.  Overall this pill is just fabulous.  Remember ladies, everybody is different so be patient.  I know that's easier sad that done, and lord knows the men in our lives don't totally understand our mood changes, but work with your doctor to get the best pill for you.

column2: iLOVEtrivora, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Yaz and LoEstrin made me gain weight, have extremely sore breasts,extreme mood swings, spotting, hair loss,and cramping and cost me a lot of $$$. Trivora has been amazing! In the 11 months of taking Trivora I've lost over 15 lbs, no breast soreness,and no hair loss! My only complaint is the mood swings but they're controllable, nothing out of the ordinary. HIGHLY RECOMEND TRIVORA! (plus its only $25 a pack, even without insurance)Trivora doesn't help much with acne though.

column2: Na'Tasha, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for a while now and I get very irritable and moody, I can't eat, sleep. I get constant headaches, very nauseous, but I was prescribed this medication for Dysfunctional Uterine Bleeding because of a hormone imbalance but  it's making the imbalance even worse...I just want the hysterectomy and get it over with! I'm tired of being in pain!!

column2: Raenbow, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Trivora for about 1 and a half years now. I get very bloated right before I get my period. I have at least 1 migraine every month about a week before my period and it has lowered my sex drive dramatically. I hope the new pill I start taking tomorrow reduces the migraines and brings back my sex drive.I don't want to be on Trivora anymore..

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this medicine for a couple months now to have normal regular periods. No nausea, vomiting, stomach pains, which is really nice because I'm very sensitive to most medications.

column2: hma0901, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Trivora 28s for 5 years and finally have decided to switch. The pill is very effective against pregnancy as I have never had a scare. However, for me this pill cause weight gain (with NO breast size increase) moodiness, a great reduce in my sex drive, I just never thought they were related to my pill! I also experience heavy long periods and terrible cramping, bloating, and PMS related acne outbreaks. This pill is not terrible and clearly I've agreed with it for 5 years but with all the new pill options out there I really want more from my birth control. An okay pill with out ant terrible or scary side effects, I'm just looking for more.

column2: I love acne...not!, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have acne. I've always had acne. With Yaz I had the following results: extremely sore breast, increase in bra-size, weight gain, swelling and constant bloated feeling, depression and CLEAR SKIN! I am currently on TRIVORA for 3months and at 24.95 a month,I love it! I have no symptoms at all except that I've lost almost 20 pounds and my face is engulfed in acne. I am very happy now and seldomly have mood swings, and best part is that my breasts don't hurt. Problem is, i have acne.  may stick to Trivora for another month to see if it'll help with time. if not, i may try something new

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
rosieposey, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Well, I haven't gotten pregnant... My doctor told me to expect side effects for the first 3 months, which I was expecting anyway. I can tolerate the cramping, that's the least of the problems.  I've gained probably about 15-20 lbs since I started taking Trivora. Even that is alright.. ish. But by far the worst thing is the mood swings.  I absolutely can't believe what this does to me.  I find myself crying over little things that aren't a big deal.  Not just tearing up, but actually sobbing and later I wonder what I was so upset about.  I guess on the positive side it has somewhat cleared up my pimples, and I do like that my periods are shorter and predictable.  Maybe I just got unlucky with the side effects but I'm seriously considering switching to a different pill.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Trivora for about 8 months. Since I've started taking it my weight has fluctuated like crazy when it used to be fairly constant. Also, I've experienced horrible migraines the first two days of my period like clockwork. However, I used to experience very long heavy periods and a lot of cramps, and since taking trivora my periods are down to about 4-5 days and are much lighter. I'll be switching pills to correct the headache problem, but for the most part I was happy with Trivora.

column2: Shafer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking off of Trivora, but my period has not begun and I am not pregnant.  Has any one else had this happen? Should I be worried?

column2: mejiasoto, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I weighed around 195 and stood 5'2" during my senior year in High School. I started taking Trivora after a diagnosis of PCOS. I began loosing weight after about 2 months of starting, and after a little less than a year I weighed 105 pounds and wore a size 00!! It was amazing!! I didn't have to diet or work out- just the fact that my hormones were finally balanced out made me loose weight. The little magic pill that you take and loose weight...I found it!!

column2: extremely satisfied , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: bennett, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: behrns89, 19-24 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

The worst part is the yeast infections, which occur seemingly every other month. Periods are very regular and light, no cramps.

column2: MrsCKR, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Before taking Trivora, I had 4 day long periods with very severe cramps, heavy bleeding, and mood swings.  I have been on it for 2 months and have experienced continuous mild to moderate cramping, spotting, weight gain, and depression.  My period lasted for a full two weeks, and I'm still spotting even though I don't know how there could possibly be anything else in there. The depression has been the worst thing with a lack of energy, crying all the time, and an overall total lack of control over my emotions.  I'm going to finish this month's pack and will discontinue use if I don't see improvement before then.

column2: Bridget, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Trivora has been a blessing!  Effective, very mild side effects, and good for someone sensitive to other pills. About a year ago I started taking Ortho Tri Cyclen and within days developed a severe allergic reaction.  I had hives on my body for 2 weeks.  I stopped and switched to Trivora after the rash cleared up and have had a wonderful experience since then.  Very little nausea during the first month, and most importantly no allergic reactions!  So if you're sensitive to Ortho, I'd recommend this as an alternative to try!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Love it, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I love Trivora! I've tried Ortho-Tri Cyclen Lo (mood swings), Lo-Ovral (weight gain), and now on Trivora its great! No weight gain, no mood swings, light periods, no cramping, no headaches & to top it off higher sex drive!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on this birth control pill for two days and I have experienced severe chest pains accompanied by excessive saliva. I will be switching as soon as I can talk to my doctor. I refuse to continue this birth control pill.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Trivora-28 for 1 month and 2 weeks.  It is very effective as far as birth control is concerned.  However, in my experience I really don't think it's worth it.  Since day 2 I've been nauseated for at least half of each day.  During the first 2 weeks every month I vomit at least once.  Nasty smells, sights, etc. all cause the same effect at any time of the month.  I've also started experiencing carsickness which has NEVER been a problem for me.  Also, my mind drives me to sudden depression, especially on the days that I'm very sick.  Severe migraines, although I'm not sure if those are associated directly with the pill.  However it has made my period very regular, light, and controlled.  I used to have irregular, painful, heavy periods so it is very effective in that sense too.  It's definitely not the right pill for me, but it seems to work differently for others.

column2: TiffanyWeez, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: ive been taking this medication for about 2 weeks and ive noticed a bit of nausea, and really bad mood swings..hopefully as i continue taking it, itll progressively get better!

column2: meese, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on Trivora for about a week and have already started to notice incredible emotional ups and downs. For example, yesterday, I was watching a commercial on TV and I just began to cry for no reason.  I've also had some lower abdominal pain, but that may just be attributed to my period. I've noticed that I feel a bit swollen, but this is probably due to water retention, which was listed as a side effect on the information brochure which I received with my pills. I'm planning to stay on this for a couple more months to see if my complaints improve, but if they don't, I will definitely be switching to another pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: I was on Ortho Tri Cyclene Lo for a year and switched to Tri-Sprintec to save money. After experiencing crazy mood swings and severe depression, I switched to Trivora and it was like night and day.  My mood swings disappeared and I experienced no other side effects from the drug.  I would definitely recommend Trivora, but of course, talk to your doctor since everyone is different!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I went on Trivora when I had debilitating cramps for the first 2 days of my cycle (no walking, nausea so bad I couldn't keep down water or NSAIDS). I was on Trivora for years before it switched to Triphasil. No problems with either of them for the last 12 years; NO weight gain, acne, hair growth, moodiness, tiredness, etc. No noticeable difference other than the decrease in pain during my cycle, and increase in regular cycles. THEN, the bottom fell out and Triphasil switched to Enpresse. NOT FOR ME!! My body didn't care for the estrogen, and I proceeded to have 5 yeast infections in 4 months!! I hadn't had a yeast infection in over 10 years!!! I did EVERYTHING. Stopped being intimate with my partner, boiled my underwear, threw out all my underwear and purchased new ones, used non-scented laundry detergent, and followed the Candida diet religiously for 5 months, and treated my partner. The ONLY difference was the Enpresse. I cancelled my prescription and, now gun-shy of oral hormones, I got an IUD. So far so GOOD! What a nachtmare. They say it's the same ingredients, but there was no estrogen in my Trivora or Triphasil!! Too much or too little estrogen can result in a yeast infection from what I understand. Enpresse may work for some, I hope it does, but not for me. I'm now starting to finally climb out of my depression and get my life with my partner back on track!

column2: charlie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 3 weeks now and have been had headaches most of the time and have been nausous consistantly. After reading the other posts I am talking to my Dr about discontinuing use.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 25 years old with one child. I started taking Triora almost two years ago after complaining to my doctor that it was hard for me to pay my copays on Ortho TriCyclen. I only have to pay $10 a month and have had no side effects. I hate having to take the pill and forget a lot but I'm scared of the side effects I've heard about from other forms of birth control.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: TERRIBLEEEE!! Extreme mood swings anxiety vomiting oh and not effective Became pregnant on pill when taking as instructed worst pill out there.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I am very happy with how Trivora has worked for me.  I was previously on Femcon (a monophasic) for about 5 months and it was horrible, had my period for about 2 weeks at a time, and breakthough bleeding in between.  My doctor switched me to Trivora, and I've been on it for about 3 months now and I love it.  No more breakthrough bleeding, my period is shorter (about 4 days) and I know exactly when its going to start.  I still have the mood swings that I did on the other pill, but I can deal with that.  On top of everything else, the pill is effective and it does what its supposed to do.

I have only been taking Trivora for three weeks and one day. I have noticed considerable changes from major mood swings, to a much lower sex drive, some weight gain and some acne. I am experiencing light bleeding at the beginning of fourth week taking it. I am no longer taking this drug effective after reading the 19 reviews posted.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this is my 1st month trying this pill i was off the pill for about 2 to 3 months and while i was off i had barely any ance and in this months time my ance is terrible and i never experienced this with any other pill i am defenitly not using this again

column2: on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: I've been on this pill for 5 years with no problem whatsover. My period always starts on the same day each month and it was very light, lasting 2-4 days. Awesome! I never had cramps, but did have the occassional mood swing. If you take it at the same time each day you shouldn't have any problems!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It does what it is supposed to do, but I feel sick a lot still such as headaches and being nauseous.

I've been using Trivora for about 6 months now. Sometimes I have a hard time remembering to take it. I have gained a little weight which I was pretty upset about, and it's caused some unpleasant vaginal discharge. It is effective though.

I have been taking this generic for 1 year.  Recently my period has been coming during the 3rd week of pills and lasting about 10-13 days.  Lots of break through bleeding and ruined underwear!  Other than that, good pill, I didn't get pregnant

column2: fadeaway872, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took trivora to regulate my period because I had severe cramps and HEAVY bleeding. It did nothing for me and I took it for 3 mouths.

column2: Kristin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on Trivora for 7 years. It's significantly decreased my menstral flow & it's nice knowing exactly when I'll begin my period each month. My weight has remained relatively constant. I do get a little moody just before my period, however, I believe that's true for most women. It's also very cost effective. Overall, I am very pleased with this pill.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on it for 2.5 years and haven't experienced any problems with it.

column2: Female  (Patient)
column9: After taking Triphasil for a few years without any problems, I was prescribed Trivora as a generic 3 months ago and have had nothing but unwanted bloating and really, really bad mood swings.  I have recently noticed weight gain.  I am definitley looking for another pill.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used Trivora for 6 mos. as a generic for Triphasil. This generic caused me to have yeast infections every month, and I was very moody while taking it. I asked my doctor for another generic for Triphasil and am now very pleased with that...Enpresse.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Trivora for 5 years.  I think it has lessened my menstrual cramps, but I do still get them.  It has not helped with my moodiness before my period, in fact I think I may be more moody than before taking this pill.  However, it's effective as birth control and is covered under my insurance.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on trivora for about 6 months and HATE it!  I have gained weight, become more moody, and lost my sex drive.  Looking to switch to a different pill very soon!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been using this medication for a week and am in severe pain.  I will discontinue use.  Ask your doctor to prescribe a different method of birth control.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After taking Trivora for about 8 months, I developed a case of pancreatitis. I was in excruciating pain. After hundreds of tests, my doctors believe the Trivora caused it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

column9: I was prescribed this to eleviate period pain by stopping my period all together.  It did no such thing.  In fact, although lighter my period lasted over two weeks!  Did not work for me

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor switched me from Triphasil to Trivora 2 years ago. I've been noticeably more irritable, spotting between almost every period, when I'm on my period, I pass a lot of blood clots and never did that on the Triphasil. I'm unhappy with the product and am searching for something different.

column2: m6178, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor substituted Trivora for my Triphasil and I noticed a significant amount of bloating and extreme irritability during the three months I used it.
